intro: Lathyrus satdaghensis, commonly known as the Persian vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-bearing fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and pea-like flowers in shades of pink or purple. Its seeds are enclosed in elongated pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind. Lathyrus satdaghensis is often found in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its resilience to arid conditions.
